docs.snippet: The steamship Fullon, from Southampton on the 1st inst., arrived at this port late last night. She brings London papers of the day of sailing, from which we obtain lull details of the news. a brief summary of which we received front Quebec, as...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Fullon, from Southampton on the 1st inst., arrived at this port late last night. She brings London papers of the day of sailing, from which we obtain lull details of the news. a brief summary of which we received front Quebec, as brought by the North Briton, and published yesterday morning. The intelligence relative to the war is of the most interesting character.

docs.snippet: NEWS ONE DAY LATER--ARRIVAL OF THE PHILADELPHIA--THE HEALTH OF THE PORT. The U. S. mail steamship Philadelphia, ELISHA HOWLS, Esq., commanding, left New-orleans June 5 for New-York via Havana, at which port she arrived on the morning of the 8th, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWS ONE DAY LATER--ARRIVAL OF THE PHILADELPHIA--THE HEALTH OF THE PORT. The U. S. mail steamship Philadelphia, ELISHA HOWLS, Esq., commanding, left New-orleans June 5 for New-York via Havana, at which port she arrived on the morning of the 8th, and sailed on the P. m. of the same day, arriving at this port last evening.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE FULTON.; THE EMPEROR OF AUSTRIA IN ITALY. Movement of Garibaldi--Action of the German Military Committee, &c. THE AUSTRIANS STILL IN THE LOMELLINA. Passage of the Sesia by the King of Sardinia...Napoleon at Casale. Details of European News to June 1. FORWARD MOVEMENT OF THE ALLIES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Fulton, from Southampton on the 1st inst., with details of two days later advices from Europe, arrived at this port last night. Her news has been partially anticipated by the arrival of the North Briton at Quebec. THE WAR IN ITALY. Miscellaneous Telegrams Published in the London Papers. VIENNA, Sunday, May 29---Noon.

docs.snippet: ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY--STATE OF TRADE. The mail steamship Quaker City, Captain SHUFELDT which left Havana at 7 P.M. on the 7th, arrived at this port on Saturday evening. A cargo of Coolies, Numbering 788, was landed at Havana, June 2, from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY--STATE OF TRADE. The mail steamship Quaker City, Captain SHUFELDT which left Havana at 7 P.M. on the 7th, arrived at this port on Saturday evening. A cargo of Coolies, Numbering 788, was landed at Havana, June 2, from the ship Live Yankee, twelve only having died on the voyage.

headline.main: EUROPE.; Advance in Cotton-Breadstuffs Declining-Provisions Steady-Consols 93 1.8 a 93 3-8. A GERMAN ARMY TO GUARD THE RHINE. MEETING OF THE BRITISH PARLIAMENT. The Emperor of Austria on his Way to the Seat of War. A. New Move in the Direction of Peace. The King of Sardinia Forces the Passage of the Sesia. ADVICES TWO DAYS LATER. THE NORTH BRITON AT QUEBEC. BOLD OPERATIONS OF GARIBALDI. The Austrians on the Frontier of Parma.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship North Briton, from Liverpool on Wednesday, June 1, passed Further Point at 5 o'clock on Saturday morning, and reached Quebec in the evening. The steamship Niagara, from Boston via Halifax, arrived at Liverpool on the 29th May. The steamship Bavaria, from New-York, arrived at Southampton on the 29th.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are sincerely sorry for any honest man whose business relations may lead him into any sort of connection with the contracts of our City Government. Such has been the character of that government for several years past, and such the motives of those who dealt with it for profitable returns, that it is not easy now for the public to disabuse itself of the

docs.snippet: This being one of the even days, we are enjoying the luxury of a rain. Yesterday was a magnificent day, however, clear, not hot, not cold, from daylight to midnight as pretty a specimen of a fine day as ever dawned. It will receive a first-rate...

headline.main: THE STATE EDITORIAL CONVENTION.; A Congregation of Newspaper People--Peculiarities of the Press of the Interior--Personalities of the Craft--Effects of the late Frost--Bits of Gossip from the Capitol, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: This being one of the even days, we are enjoying the luxury of a rain. Yesterday was a magnificent day, however, clear, not hot, not cold, from daylight to midnight as pretty a specimen of a fine day as ever dawned. It will receive a first-rate notice too, for it was the day for the Annual Convention of the Editorial and Typographical Association of the State at Syracuse.

docs.snippet: The last performances of the adventurer De Riviere are noticed by the Boston Atlas in reference to the alleged scandal concerning the "Captain" and two ladies from Boston: "We are informed by letters from the South that the ladies referred to are...
docs.lead_paragraph: The last performances of the adventurer De Riviere are noticed by the Boston Atlas in reference to the alleged scandal concerning the "Captain" and two ladies from Boston: "We are informed by letters from the South that the ladies referred to are very respectably connected, and have always moved in good society in this city.

docs.snippet: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--At the meeting of the Health Commissioners, yesterday, Dr. GUNN reported this arrival of the brig Hebe, from Rio in 88 days, with a cargo of coffee and 150 bales of hair. A part of the crew were sick while in port, but all are...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--At the meeting of the Health Commissioners, yesterday, Dr. GUNN reported this arrival of the brig Hebe, from Rio in 88 days, with a cargo of coffee and 150 bales of hair. A part of the crew were sick while in port, but all are now well. Her cargo was ordered to lightered to Quarantine, and the vessel to be permitted to come up after having been detained a suitable time for inspection.
